keyHighlights: Top performing post is a text post with 191 likes.
Image posts (avg engagement: 77) significantly outperform text posts (avg engagement: 43).
Posts on Monday and Thursday receive significantly higher engagement.
executiveSummary.summaryText: This report analyzes the LinkedIn performance data for Kanishk Parashar, covering detailed client posts, audience engagement, posting patterns, and influencer strategies. It synthesizes key metrics across likes, and comments to provide a comprehensive view. Insights into content effectiveness and timing are highlighted. Recommendations are offered to boost engagement and diversify content strategy.

contentAnalysis.visualImpactInsight: Image posts (avg engagement: 77) significantly outperform text posts (avg engagement: 43).
contentAnalysis.postTypeDistributionInsight: Text posts dominate with 84.75% share, suggesting an opportunity to diversify with more images and articles.

topPerformingPosts.content:
I have an exciting secret to share! Back in April 2024, we successfully raised our seed round during YCombinator. üöÄ

Wondering why the big news is only coming out now? The answer is simple: since April, we've been hard at work onboarding and expanding Powder. And now, the time has come to elevate it to the next level! For those who are new to our journey, securing funding from top-tier VC firms enhances our credibility. Testimonials from leading firms further establish trust in our vision. As a result, we're now receiving a steady influx of interest from potential customers, partners, future teammates, and more! Exciting times ahead as we continue to grow and innovate. Stay tuned for more updates on our progress! #FundingNews #StartupJourney #GrowthOpportunities
I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as co-founder / CEO at Powder!

üéâ Today marks 2 years since I embarked on this incredible journey to build a startup, and I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for the experiences, challenges, and growth along the way. It all started back in October 2022 when I began exploring ideas, fueled by a desire to make a real impact... #StartupJourney #Entrepreneurship #AI #WealthManagement #Gratitude

Powder is my third venture-backed startup, and I've had the privilege of working with some truly amazing VCs in the past. But during the YC Winter '24 batch, I discovered something extraordinary, something I never knew was possible in an investor relationship. Collaborating with Garry Tan sparked in me a profound and unshakable belief that, no matter the challenges we encounter, we are gonna make it!  That we are going to end up building a remarkable company. This mentality holds deep personal significance for me! On that note, this year YC is starting a fall batch!! Get your application in by 8/27!

commonCharacteristicsTopPosts: Clear and concise messaging paired with strong storytelling
Timely and relevant updates resonate well with the audience

post.text: Most Job Seekers Fail These 10 Interview Questions. Heres How to Ace Them. Join to receive 50+ Al courses ,1000+ Advanced Prompts, 30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more.100% FREE - Spoiler: Its not about perfect answers. Its about strategic storytelling. Heres your cheat sheet to outsmart 95% of applicants: 4 Deadly Interview Categories 1 Storytelling & Fit: Tell me your story DO: My journey from [past role] to [this role] shows why Im obsessed with [company mission]. DONT: Ramble about your birth year or dogs name. What sets you apart? DO: My top 3 strengths[X], [Y], [Z]are why Ive [specific win]. They align perfectly with [job need]. DONT: Im a hard worker. (Snore.) 2 Problem-Solving & Ethics: Hardest problem you solved DO: Use the STAR method Situation, Task, Action, Result + Metrics. DONT: Blame teammates or say I dont remember. Ethical dilemma DO: I chose integrity over shortcuts. Heres how it hurt short-term but built long-term trust. DONT: Ive never faced one. (Liar.) 3 Strengths, Weaknesses & Growth: Greatest strengths DO: Mirror the job description You need [skill]. Ive done [example]. DONT: Im good at everything. Weaknesses DO: Im impatient with inefficiency Now I automate repetitive tasks. DONT: Im a perfectionist. (Eye roll.) 4 Initiative & Execution: Problem others missed DO: I spotted [issue] by [method]. Fixing it saved [time/money]. DONT: Im just really detail-oriented. Missed deadline DO: I communicated early, renegotiated timelines, and delivered [result]. DONT: Blame others or make excuses. Free Tutorials you will regret not taking in 2025 : 7000+ free courses free access: Data Science: C++ : Python : React JS : jQuery : DSA - Git : JavaScript : Money Making Resources:

post.text: DeepSeek has now erased $2 trillion worth of market cap in US stocks. NVIDIA just lost $500B+ in market cap! Update: All because a $6M Chinese AI startup just achieved what Silicon Valley claimed was impossible. Heres why DeepSeek is rewriting the rules of AI : Chinas DeepSeek just built a reasoning AI model that rivals OpenAIs bestand did it for 1/1000th of the cost. OpenAIs GPT-4: $600M+ training cost DeepSeek: $6M total And DeepSeek R1 is open source. DeepSeek is not just cheaper to buildits also cheaper to run. OpenAI: $100+ per million tokens DeepSeek: <$4 per million tokens This isnt just a cost differenceits a paradigm shift. Silicon Valleys AI advantage? Its evaporating. Tech investors in panic mode Global attention shifts to Chinas AI dominance. What if we dont need that many GPUs or even electricity to build better Models! DeepSeek R1 is: 27x cheaper than OpenAIs models Open source and permissively licensed A model that fully discloses reasoning steps This isnt just competition. As Marc Andreesen said Its Sputnik for AI. The game is changingand fast. Whats your take on this AI revolution? Lets discuss. "This image is a conceptual representation created for illustration" #AI #DeepSeek #Innovation

post.text: "The IT department of every company is going to be the HR department of AI agents in the future. Today, they manage and maintain a bunch of software from the IT industry. In the future, they will maintain, nurture, onboard, and improve a whole bunch of digital agents and provision them to the companies to use. And so, your IT department is gonna become kind of like AI Agent HR." - Jensen Huang, CEO ofNVIDIA, CES 2025 Stressed about AI in 2025? Catch up on the biggest year in AI, and read my 2024 AI recap here:

post.text: In our new paper we ran an experiment at Procter and Gamble with 776 experienced professionals solving real business problems. We found that individuals randomly assiged to use AI did as well as a team of two without AI. And AI-augmented teams produced more exceptional solutions. The teams using AI were happier as well. Even more interesting: AI broke down professional silos. R&D people with AI produced more commercial work and commercial people with AI had more technical solutions. The standard model of "AI as productivity tool" may be too limiting. Todays AI can function as a kind of teammate, offering better performance, expertise sharing, and even positive emotional experiences. This was a massive team effort with work led by Fabrizio Dell'Acqua, Charles Ayoubi, and Karim Lakhani along with Hila Lifshitz, Raffaella Sadun, Lilach M., me and our partners at P&G: Yi Han, Jeff Goldman, Hari Nair and Stewart Taub Subatack about the work here: Paper:

post.text: Still pinching myself My book was just listed in the New & Noteworthy section at Barnes & Noble and to top it off, we officially hit the Bestseller list this week! This is such a full-circle moment. I wrote this book to help leaders navigate the new era of AI with confidence, clarity, and purpose and now its sitting on shelves alongside some of the most impactful voices of our time. Im so grateful. To every reader, supporter, and believer in the mission of Responsible AI thank you. This book isnt just a celebration of whats possible, but a blueprint for how we lead into the future. You can grab your copy now at Barnes & Noble or wherever books are sold. Lets build whats next together. #AILeadership #Bestseller #ResponsibleAI #Gratitude #NewAndNoteworthy

summaryOfComparison: The client demonstrates solid baseline performance, but top industry influencers benefit from a more balanced content mix, higher visual engagement, and optimized posting schedules. Focusing on these areas could help close the gap in engagement metrics.

gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Introduce more image and video posts to diversify content.

gapAnalysis.influencerAverage: Consistent high engagement on optimal days
gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Align posting times with peak engagement days like Monday and Thursday.

recommendations.contentStrategy: Diversify content types by integrating more videos and articles to reduce over-reliance on text posts.
recommendations.visualElements: Enhance posts with high-quality images and graphics to capitalize on their higher engagement rate.
recommendations.postingSchedule: Adjust posting times to target peak engagement periods, particularly on Monday and Thursday.
recommendations.audienceTargeting: Tailor messaging to appeal specifically to technology and finance professionals.
recommendations.engagementTactics: Incorporate interactive elements like polls and Q&A sessions to boost audience interaction.
